com.tikal.jenkins.plugins.multijob.Multi.description: WARNING: THIS IS AN AUTO-GENERATED JOB DEFINITION. CHANGES MADE USING THE ONLINE EDITOR WILL NOT BE HONORED. MAKE CHANGES TO THE JOB DEFINITIONS IN THE openshift/aos-cd-jobs REPOSITORY INSTEAD.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: JENKINS_TARGET_BRANCH
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The branch in the jenkins repository to test against.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: BUILD_ID
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The ID that prow sets on a Jenkins job in order to correlate it with a ProwJob.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: REPO_OWNER
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: GitHub org that triggered the job.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: REPO_NAME
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: GitHub repo that triggered the job.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: JENKINS_PULL_ID
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The pull-request in the jenkins repository to test.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: PULL_NUMBER
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The pull-request in the jenkins repository to test. This is compatible with prow.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: PULL_REFS
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The pull-request(s) in the jenkins repository to test. This is compatible with prow and can be used for batch testing.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: buildId
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The ID that prow sets on a Jenkins job in order to correlate it with a ProwJob and bubble statuses up to the correct pull request.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: MERGE_SEVERITY
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: How important this pull request is.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash SCRIPT_START_TIME="$( date +%s )" && export SCRIPT_START_TIME && echo "########## STARTING STAGE: INSTALL THE ORIGIN-CI-TOOL ##########" && trap 'export status=FAILURE' ERR && trap 'set +o xtrace; SCRIPT_END_TIME="$( date +%s )"; ELAPSED_TIME="$(( SCRIPT_END_TIME - SCRIPT_START_TIME ))"; echo "########## FINISHED STAGE: ${status:-SUCCESS}: INSTALL THE ORIGIN-CI-TOOL [$( printf "%02dh %02dm %02ds" "$(( ELAPSED_TIME/3600 ))" "$(( (ELAPSED_TIME%3600)/60 ))" "$(( ELAPSED_TIME%60 ))" )] ##########"' EXIT && set -o errexit -o nounset -o pipefail -o xtrace && if [[ -s "${WORKSPACE}/activate" ]]; then source "${WORKSPACE}/activate"; fi latest="$( readlink "${HOME}/origin-ci-tool/latest" )" touch "${latest}" cp "${latest}/bin/activate" "${WORKSPACE}/activate" cat >> "${WORKSPACE}/activate" <<EOF export OCT_CONFIG_HOME="${WORKSPACE}/.config" EOF
source "${WORKSPACE}/activate" mkdir -p "${OCT_CONFIG_HOME}" rm -rf "${OCT_CONFIG_HOME}/origin-ci-tool" oct configure ansible-client verbosity 2 oct configure aws-client 'keypair_name' 'libra' oct configure aws-client 'private_key_path' '/var/lib/jenkins/.ssh/devenv.pem' [ -z "$ROOT_VOLUME_SIZE" ] || oct configure aws-defaults master_root_volume_size $ROOT_VOLUME_SIZE

hudson.plugins.descriptionsetter.Descrip.description: Using PR ${JENKINS_PULL_ID} merged into the jenkins ${JENKINS_TARGET_BRANCH} branch.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command: #!/bin/bash SCRIPT_START_TIME="$( date +%s )" && export SCRIPT_START_TIME && echo "########## STARTING STAGE: FORWARD PARAMETERS TO THE REMOTE HOST ##########" && trap 'export status=FAILURE' ERR && trap 'set +o xtrace; SCRIPT_END_TIME="$( date +%s )"; ELAPSED_TIME="$(( SCRIPT_END_TIME - SCRIPT_START_TIME ))"; echo "########## FINISHED STAGE: ${status:-SUCCESS}: FORWARD PARAMETERS TO THE REMOTE HOST [$( printf "%02dh %02dm %02ds" "$(( ELAPSED_TIME/3600 ))" "$(( (ELAPSED_TIME%3600)/60 ))" "$(( ELAPSED_TIME%60 ))" )] ##########"' EXIT && set -o errexit -o nounset -o pipefail -o xtrace && if [[ -s "${WORKSPACE}/activate" ]]; then source "${WORKSPACE}/activate"; fi ssh -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config openshiftdevel sudo chmod o+rw /etc/environment ssh -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config openshiftdevel "echo 'JENKINS_TARGET_BRANCH=${JENKINS_TARGET_BRANCH:-}' >> /etc/environment" ssh -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config openshiftdevel "echo 'PULL_REFS=${PULL_REFS:-}' >> /etc/environment" ssh -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config openshiftdevel "echo 'buildId=${buildId:-}' >> /etc/environment" ssh -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config openshiftdevel "echo 'BUILD_ID=${BUILD_ID:-}' >> /etc/environment" ssh -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config openshiftdevel "echo 'REPO_OWNER=${REPO_OWNER:-}' >> /etc/environment" ssh -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config openshiftdevel "echo 'REPO_NAME=${REPO_NAME:-}' >> /etc/environment" ssh -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config openshiftdevel "echo 'JENKINS_PULL_ID=${JENKINS_PULL_ID:-}' >> /etc/environment" ssh -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config openshiftdevel "echo 'PULL_NUMBER=${PULL_NUMBER:-}' >> /etc/environment"

#!/bin/bash SCRIPT_START_TIME="$( date +%s )" && export SCRIPT_START_TIME && echo "########## STARTING STAGE: BUILD AND INSTALL S2I ##########" && trap 'export status=FAILURE' ERR && trap 'set +o xtrace; SCRIPT_END_TIME="$( date +%s )"; ELAPSED_TIME="$(( SCRIPT_END_TIME - SCRIPT_START_TIME ))"; echo "########## FINISHED STAGE: ${status:-SUCCESS}: BUILD AND INSTALL S2I [$( printf "%02dh %02dm %02ds" "$(( ELAPSED_TIME/3600 ))" "$(( (ELAPSED_TIME%3600)/60 ))" "$(( ELAPSED_TIME%60 ))" )] ##########"' EXIT && set -o errexit -o nounset -o pipefail -o xtrace && if [[ -s "${WORKSPACE}/activate" ]]; then source "${WORKSPACE}/activate"; fi script="$( mktemp )" cat <<SCRIPT >"${script}" #!/bin/bash set -o errexit -o nounset -o pipefail -o xtrace cd "\${GOPATH}/src/github.com/openshift/source-to-image" make build sudo cp /data/src/github.com/openshift/source-to-image/_output/local/bin/linux/amd64/s2i /usr/bin SCRIPT chmod +x "${script}" scp -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config "${script}" openshiftdevel:"${script}" ssh -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config -t openshiftdevel "bash -l -c \"timeout 300 ${script}\""

#!/bin/bash SCRIPT_START_TIME="$( date +%s )" && export SCRIPT_START_TIME && echo "########## STARTING STAGE: BUILD BASE RHEL IMAGES ##########" && trap 'export status=FAILURE' ERR && trap 'set +o xtrace; SCRIPT_END_TIME="$( date +%s )"; ELAPSED_TIME="$(( SCRIPT_END_TIME - SCRIPT_START_TIME ))"; echo "########## FINISHED STAGE: ${status:-SUCCESS}: BUILD BASE RHEL IMAGES [$( printf "%02dh %02dm %02ds" "$(( ELAPSED_TIME/3600 ))" "$(( (ELAPSED_TIME%3600)/60 ))" "$(( ELAPSED_TIME%60 ))" )] ##########"' EXIT && set -o errexit -o nounset -o pipefail -o xtrace && if [[ -s "${WORKSPACE}/activate" ]]; then source "${WORKSPACE}/activate"; fi script="$( mktemp )" cat <<SCRIPT >"${script}" #!/bin/bash set -o errexit -o nounset -o pipefail -o xtrace cd "\${HOME}" # purpose of this job is to build images that have subscriptions+necessary repos built in. # if you don't need a registry.access.redhat.com/rhel7 with such additions, don't use # this job as a parent
# inside temporary directory create docker build context for the new base image contextdir=\$(mktemp -d)
# copy the necessary files mkdir \$contextdir/{certs,repos,vars,keys} cp /var/lib/yum/*.pem \$contextdir/certs cp /etc/yum/vars/* \$contextdir/vars cp /etc/yum.repos.d/* \$contextdir/repos cp /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/* \$contextdir/keys
# Remove repositories we won't be needing and which require RH certs rm -rf \$contextdir/repos/redhat-rhui*
# remove google chrome repo rm -rf \$contextdir/repos/*chrome*.repo
# remove local openshift epel mirror - we will only temporarily mount this via imagebuilder during image builds rm -rf \$contextdir/repos/local_epel.repo
# Add the online-int repo which has the latest jenkins rpms cat <<EOF > \$contextdir/repos/rhel-7-server-ose-onlineint-rpms.repo [rhel-7-server-ose-onlineint-rpms] baseurl = https://mirror.openshift.com/enterprise/online-int/latest/x86_64/os/ failovermethod = priority gpgcheck = 0 gpgkey = file:///etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-redhat-release, file:///etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-redhat-beta, https://mirror.ops.rhcloud.com/libra/keys/RPM-GPG-KEY-redhat-openshifthosted name = A repository of dependencies for Atomic OpenShift Online-Int sslclientcert = /var/lib/yum/client-cert.pem sslclientkey = /var/lib/yum/client-key.pem sslverify = 0
EOF
# create Dockerfile cat <<EOF > \$contextdir/Dockerfile FROM registry.access.redhat.com/openshift3/ose:latest
RUN yum remove -y subscription-manager
ADD vars/* /etc/yum/vars/ ADD repos/* /etc/yum.repos.d/ ADD certs/* /var/lib/yum/ ADD keys/* /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/
RUN yum update -y && yum clean all ENTRYPOINT [] EOF
docker build --rm -t registry.access.redhat.com/openshift3/ose \$contextdir
# make sure the new image has valid certs docker run registry.access.redhat.com/openshift3/ose yum install -y tar
# create Dockerfile cat <<EOF > \$contextdir/Dockerfile FROM registry.access.redhat.com/openshift3/ose:v3.6
RUN yum remove -y subscription-manager
ADD vars/* /etc/yum/vars/ ADD repos/* /etc/yum.repos.d/ ADD certs/* /var/lib/yum/ ADD keys/* /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/
RUN yum update -y && yum clean all ENTRYPOINT [] EOF
docker build --rm -t registry.access.redhat.com/openshift3/ose:v3.6 \$contextdir
# make sure the new image has valid certs docker run registry.access.redhat.com/openshift3/ose:v3.6 yum install -y tar # this docker tag is for the jenkins image repo 3.6 branch; we did not introduce # the use of the ose image until 3.7 docker tag registry.access.redhat.com/openshift3/ose:v3.6 registry.access.redhat.com/rhel7
# cleaning rm -rf \$contextdir SCRIPT chmod +x "${script}" scp -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config "${script}" openshiftdevel:"${script}" ssh -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config -t openshiftdevel "bash -l -c \"timeout 3600 ${script}\""

#!/bin/bash SCRIPT_START_TIME="$( date +%s )" && export SCRIPT_START_TIME && echo "########## STARTING STAGE: BUILD THE JENKINS IMAGES ##########" && trap 'export status=FAILURE' ERR && trap 'set +o xtrace; SCRIPT_END_TIME="$( date +%s )"; ELAPSED_TIME="$(( SCRIPT_END_TIME - SCRIPT_START_TIME ))"; echo "########## FINISHED STAGE: ${status:-SUCCESS}: BUILD THE JENKINS IMAGES [$( printf "%02dh %02dm %02ds" "$(( ELAPSED_TIME/3600 ))" "$(( (ELAPSED_TIME%3600)/60 ))" "$(( ELAPSED_TIME%60 ))" )] ##########"' EXIT && set -o errexit -o nounset -o pipefail -o xtrace && if [[ -s "${WORKSPACE}/activate" ]]; then source "${WORKSPACE}/activate"; fi script="$( mktemp )" cat <<SCRIPT >"${script}" #!/bin/bash set -o errexit -o nounset -o pipefail -o xtrace cd "\${GOPATH}/src/github.com/openshift/jenkins" make build TARGET=rhel7 make build TARGET=centos7 SCRIPT chmod +x "${script}" scp -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config "${script}" openshiftdevel:"${script}" ssh -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config -t openshiftdevel "bash -l -c \"timeout 10800 ${script}\""

#!/bin/bash SCRIPT_START_TIME="$( date +%s )" && export SCRIPT_START_TIME && echo "########## STARTING STAGE: TEST THE JENKINS IMAGES ##########" && trap 'export status=FAILURE' ERR && trap 'set +o xtrace; SCRIPT_END_TIME="$( date +%s )"; ELAPSED_TIME="$(( SCRIPT_END_TIME - SCRIPT_START_TIME ))"; echo "########## FINISHED STAGE: ${status:-SUCCESS}: TEST THE JENKINS IMAGES [$( printf "%02dh %02dm %02ds" "$(( ELAPSED_TIME/3600 ))" "$(( (ELAPSED_TIME%3600)/60 ))" "$(( ELAPSED_TIME%60 ))" )] ##########"' EXIT && set -o errexit -o nounset -o pipefail -o xtrace && if [[ -s "${WORKSPACE}/activate" ]]; then source "${WORKSPACE}/activate"; fi script="$( mktemp )" cat <<SCRIPT >"${script}" #!/bin/bash set -o errexit -o nounset -o pipefail -o xtrace cd "\${GOPATH}/src/github.com/openshift/jenkins" make test TARGET=rhel7 TAG_ON_SUCCESS=true make test TARGET=centos7 TAG_ON_SUCCESS=true SCRIPT chmod +x "${script}" scp -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config "${script}" openshiftdevel:"${script}" ssh -F ./.config/origin-ci-tool/inventory/.ssh_config -t openshiftdevel "bash -l -c \"timeout 7200 ${script}\""

#!/bin/bash set -o errexit -o nounset -o pipefail -o xtrace if [[ -z "${PULL_REFS:-}" ]]; then test_pull_requests --merge_pull_request "${JENKINS_PULL_ID}" --repo jenkins --config ~/test_pull_requests/jenkins.json fi
